title.en: Cultural Heritage Acquisition and Digitisation Application Profile (CHAD-AP)

comments.en: The Cultural Heritage Acquisition and Digitisation Application Profile (CHAD-AP, https://w3id.org/dharc/ontology/chad-ap) is a CIDOC CRM application profile implemented as an OWL ontology that can be logically split into two separate abstract modules: the _Object Module_ (OM), dedicated to describing the CH objects, and the _Process Module_ (PM), for describing the acquisition and digitisation process.

abstract.value: A OWL 2 DL-based metadata application profile for describing cultural heritage digitisation data and processes in a FAIR-compliant and machine-readable format.

title.value: Cultural Heritage Acquisition and Digitisation Application Profile (CHAD-AP)

bibliographicCitation.value: Barzaghi, S. and Peroni, S. (2024). Cultural Heritage Acquisition and Digitisation Application Profile. https://w3id.org/dharc/ontology/chad-ap.

comment.en: An action intentionally carried out by one or more actors.
An activity in which a digital device runs a software program on a digital object.
An activity that results in the continuity of management and the preservation and evolution of a collection.
The realisation of a work, referring to the intellectual content of a cultural heritage object.
A persistent physical item of any size that is purposely created by human activity.
A categorical concept denoted by terms from thesauri and controlled vocabularies used to characterize and classify other entities.
An information object that makes propositions about reality.
An abstract temporal extent having a beginning, an end and a duration.
A geographical location.
A technical tool that is used to process or produce digital objects.
An activity that represents the creation of a work.
An activity that results in the production of data objects functioning as digital representations of physical entities.
A computer program.
A textual string assigned to a cultural heritage object in order to identify it uniquely within a given context.
An individual person.
A digital object that is the direct result of an activity in a digitization workflow.
The physical instance of a cultural heritage object.
A work that is composed of other works.
An immaterial item that has an objectively recognizable structure and is documented as a single unit.
The essence or conceptualization of a cultural heritage object.
A collection of physical objects that is assembled and maintained by one or more actors over time for a specific purpose and audience.
An activity that represents the creation of an expression.
A unified group of people.
A textual string that functions as a title for a work.
An individual person or a group of people, with the potential to perform intentional and accountable actions.
This property associates a digitization activity with the software that was used during that activity.

label.fr: a pour résidence actuelle ou antérieure

comment.en: This property describes the current or former place of residence of an actor.
This property associates a phenomenon with the time span during which that phenomenon was on-going.
This property describes the precise ending date and time of a time span.
This property contains the textual description of an entity.

label.pt: é o período de tempo de

comment.en: This property associates a title with the work bearing that title.
This property describes the maximum period of time within which a time span falls.
This property identifies some entity that is depicted by a physical object.
This property associates an activity in a digitization workflow with a digital object used as input for that activity.
This property associates a curation activity with a collection involved in such activity.

label.de: ist früherer oder derzeitiger Betreuer von
label.en: is former or current keeper of
label.fr: est l’actant détenteur actuel ou antérieur de

comment.en: This property associates a symbolic object with a textual representation of its content.
This property describes the use of a tool for performing an activity.
This property associates a complex work with a work that forms part of it.
This property associates an activity in a digitization workflow with a digital object produced as a result of that activity.
This property associates an expression creation with the first physical objects in which the resulting expression was embodied.
This property describes the participation of one or more actors in an event.
This property describes the precise beginning date and time of a time span.
This property refers to the fact that a document describes some entity.
This property associates the expression that was first externalised during a particular creation event with that particular creation event.
This property allows typing of an entity through the use of an external knowledge organization system, such as a thesaurus or a controlled vocabulary.
This property records the preferred identifier used to identify an entity.
This property associates a period of time with another period of time it contains.
This property identifies the technique or method that was employed during an activity.
This property associates a digitization process with the cultural heritage object that is being digitized.
This property associates an expression creation with the corresponding work.

label.de: ist derzeitiger oder früherer Sitz von
label.en: is current or former residence of
label.fr: est la résidence actuelle ou antérieure de

comment.en: This property documents that some statement refers to a cultural heritage object.
This property describes the active, accountable participation of an actor during an activity.

label.fr: a pour actant détenteur actuel ou antérieur

comment.en: This property identifies an actor who has or has had custody of a physical entity at some time.
This property documents that an expression has as subject some entity.
This property associates a physical entity with another physical entity that forms part of it.

label.fr: a eu lieu en présence de

comment.en: This property describes the presence of an entity during an event, without implying any specific role.
